title: Junior Software Developer
description: Description  Ready for your next career step? Leidos is currently seeking to hire a Junior Software Developer to support S3I on Redstone Arsenal located in Huntsville, Alabama.The selected candidate will be a member of a highly dynamic team providing software development and support to the AvMC Software, Simulation, Systems Engineering and Integration (S3I) Directorate. The applicant should be able to demonstrate the ability to support application design, development, testing, and documentation. Candidate will support and participate in system/subsystem design, performance studies and analyses; interpret and analyze requirements obtained/derived from customer; review, verify and/or validate system specifications and other design-related documentation; and software design review, technical interchange and management control meetings, and configuration control boards.Required Skills:1+ year of professional software development experience in C or C++.Experienced developer with Unreal 4 or 5.Comfortable working in a collaborative, team-oriented environment.Desired Skills:Experience developing software for Army training / gaming platforms.Experience reviewing, analyzing, and testing Software Requirements Specification (SRS) level requirements.Experience working with automated test environments and Hardware-In-the-Loop (HWIL) test stations.Experience using Jira, Bugzilla, Collaborator and/or SVN in a professional environment.Experience on previous teams using an Agile/Scrum process.Basic Qualifications:Required Education: Bachelor's degree and one year of related experience; additional years of experience accepted in lieu of degree. Required Clearance: Must have the ability to able to obtain an interim Secret Clearance and then obtain and maintain a full Secret Clearance; ship required.Work Flexibility: Job location is in Huntsville, Alabama with onsite work being ideal. Remote work option is available.Pay Range:Pay Range $53,300.00 - $82,000.00 - $110,700.00The Leidos pay range for this job level is a general guideline only and not a guarantee of compensation or salary. Additional factors considered in extending an offer include (but are not limited to) responsibilities of the job, education, experience, knowledge, skills, and abilities, as well as internal equity, alignment with market data, applicable bargaining agreement (if any), or other law.#RemoteReport this jobDice Id: SCNCAPI2Position Id: R-00109003

title: Junior Software Engineer
description: Junior Software Engineer  Position Description  The successful candidate will have experience within an agile environment (preferably SAFe Agile) and will have experience with a combination of back end and front-end development utilizing some of the following technologies:• Java• Docker, Kubernetes, AWS• Postgres, Spring boot, Cloud Foundry, Restful services• Eureka, Kibana, ActiveMQ, IntelliJ, Jenkins technical environment.• typescript, nodejs, twitter bootstrap• Nice to have: Python, Ruby, AngularLooking for the following qualities:• Resourcefulness - ability and desire to dig in to solve problems,• Aptitude and willingness to learn and grow while having fun on a dynamic team,• Excellent communication skills and ability to communicate clearly with clients and team members in other locations,• Leadership - ability to provide leadership within the team,• Personable and able to have a laugh while being focused to work towards deadlines.Responsibilities will include:• Pointing user stories• Working within scrum teams consisting of PO, SM, other engineers, and testers• Understanding requirements within user stories• Owning user stories and working independently• Troubleshooting and working within a team structure of 5 - 10 team members• Unit testing work• Ability to do more complex testing on user stories (that you didn't code) when the team needs to swarm at end of sprint• Deploying into a pipeline• Being client-facing, so excellent written and verbal communication• Raising and mitigating risks within a team• Overcoming issues - resourcefulness!Excellent verbal and written communication skills are a must.Required qualification to be successful in this role:- Agile/Scrum experience- 2 years Java experience, Docker, Kubernetes, AWS, Spring, Restful Services, Javascript, Javascript frameworks.Postgres, Spring boot, Cloud Foundry, Restful services, Eureka, Kibana, ActiveMQ, IntelliJ, Jenkins, typescript, nodejs, twitter bootstrap- 2+ years of SW engineering- Analytical skills: Detail oriented with ability to critically evaluate information gathered from multiple sources, reconcile conflicts, decompose high-level information into details, abstract up from low-level information to a more general understanding, distinguish presented user requests from the underlying true needs, and distinguish solution ideas from requirements.- Organizational skills: Ability to work with the information gathered during requirements analysis and to exercise flexibility with changing business priorities- Interpersonal skills: Must be able to help negotiate priorities and to resolve conflicts among representatives from various business and development teams- Team skills: Works will with others, delivers positive energy to their teamTime Management skills: Ability to work in a fast-paced team environment and consistently meet deadlines and work independently with minimal supervisionAs a Federal Contractor, all members of CGI Federal, regardless of role or work location are required to be fully vaccinated, with the exception of those with approved medical or religious accommodations.CGI is required by law in some jurisdictions to include a reasonable estimate of the compensation range for this role. The determination of this range includes various factors not limited to skill set, level, experience, relevant training, and licensure and certifications. To support the ability to reward for merit-based performance, CGI typically does not hire individuals at or near the top of the range for their role. Compensation decisions are dependent on the facts and circumstances of each case. A reasonable estimate of the current range for this role in the U.S. is $ 67,000-146,900 #CGIFederalJob#Dice#LI-AD1Your future duties and responsibilitiesRequired qualifications to be successful in this roleInsights you can act onWhile technology is at the heart of our clients' digital transformation, we understand that people are at the heart of business success. When you join CGI, you become a trusted advisor, collaborating with colleagues and clients to bring forward actionable insights that deliver meaningful and sustainable outcomes. We call our employees "members" because they are CGI shareholders and owners and owners who enjoy working and growing together to build a company we are proud of. This has been our Dream since 1976, and it has brought us to where we are today - one of the world's largest independent providers of IT and business consulting services. At CGI, we recognize the richness that diversity brings. We strive to create a work culture where all belong and collaborate with clients in building more inclusive communities. As an equal-opportunity employer, we want to empower all our members to succeed and grow. If you require an accommodation at any point during the recruitment process, please let us know. We will be happy to assist. Ready to become part of our success story? Join CGI - where your ideas and actions make a difference.Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their race, ethnicity, ancestry, color, sex, religion, creed, age, national origin, citizenship status, disability, pregnancy, medical condition, military and veteran status, marital status, sexual orientation or perceived sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, and gender expression, familial status, political affiliation, genetic information, or any other legally protected status or characteristics.CGI provides reasonable accommodations to qualified individuals with disabilities. If you need an accommodation to apply for a job in the U.S., please email the CGI U.S. Employment Compliance mailbox at US_Employment_Compliance@cgi.com . You will need to reference the requisition number of the position in which you are interested. Your message will be routed to the appropriate recruiter who will assist you. Please note, this email address is only to be used for those individuals who need an accommodation to apply for a job. Emails for any other reason or those that do not include a requisition number will not be returned.We make it easy to translate military experience and skills! Click here to be directed to our site that is dedicated to veterans and transitioning service members.All CGI offers of employment in the U.S. are contingent upon the ability to successfully complete a background investigation. Background investigation components can vary dependent upon specific assignment and/or level of US government security clearance held. CGI will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrests and conviction records in accordance with all local regulations and ordinances.CGI will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. However, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or (c) consistent with CGI's legal duty to furnish information.Report this jobDice Id: cgiamsbotPosition Id: 2185_J0423-0297

title: Junior Software Developer
description: Job Number: R0162376 Software Developer, JuniorThe Challenge:Do you want to build sof tware that solves enterprise-scale challenges while learning and growing your skills?This role is more than just coding. Our junior developers use their passion to learn new tools and te chn iques and apply them towards identifying and delivering needed sof tware solutions. You will learn sof tware development principles and how to apply them through various development methodologies, including Scrum, Scaled Agile Framework, and Kanban. Our goal in hiring a junior developer is to match your intensity and passion for sof tware development with our deep experience in the practice of sof tware delivery to help deliver products for our customers and to evolve your career.Join us. The world can't wait.You Have:Experience with Java, Python, and JavaScript in industry or academic environmentsExperience with researching, designing, developing, or modifying enterprise-wide systems or applications sof tware in an internship or academic environmentKnowledge of Web protocols and servicesAbility to work independently and within a team Ability to obtain a security clearance HS diploma or GEDNice If You Have:Experience with Agile sof tware development processes and tools, including Atlassian Tool SuiteExperience with documenting testing and maintenance of system correctionsKnowledge of Oracle or MS Structured Query LanguagePossession of excellent analysis and problem solving skillsBachelor's degreeClearance: Applicants selected will be subject to a security investigation and may need to meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information .Build Your Career:A challenging and dynamic work environment isn't all we have to offer. When you join Booz Allen, you'll have access to:experts in virtually every fielda culture that focuses on supporting our employeesopportunities that provide stability while offering varietyYou'll also be exposed to a wealth of training resources through our Digital University, an online learning portal featuring more than 5000 functional and te chn ical courses, certifications, and books. Build your te chn ical skills through hands-on training on the latest tools and tech from our in-house experts. Pursuing certifications that directly impact your role? You may be able to take advantage of our tuition assistance, on-site boot camps, certification training, academic programs, vendor relationships, and a network of professionals who can give you helpful tips. We'll help you develop the career you want as you chart your own course for success.CompensationAt Booz Allen, we celebrate your contributions, provide you with opportunities and choices, and support your total well-being. Our offerings include health, life, disability, financial, and retirement benefits, as well as paid leave, professional development, tuition assistance, work-life programs, and dependent care. Our recognition awards program acknowledges employees for exceptional performance and superior demonstration of our values. Full-time and part-time employees working at least 20 hours a week on a regular basis are eligible to participate in Booz Allen's benefit programs. Individuals that do not meet the threshold are only eligible for select offerings, not inclusive of health benefits. We encourage you to learn more about our total benefits by visiting the Resource page on our Careers site and reviewing Our Employee Benefits page.Salary at Booz Allen is determined by various factors, including but not limited to location, the individual's particular combination of education, knowledge, skills, competencies, and experience, as well as contract-specific affordability and organizational requirements. The projected compensation range for this position is $49,900.00 to $102,000.00 (annualized USD). The estimate displayed represents the typical salary range for this position and is just one component of Booz Allen's total compensation package for employees.Work ModelOur people-first culture prioritizes the benefits of flexibility and collaboration, whether that happens in person or remotely.If this position is listed as remote or hybrid, you'll periodically work from a Booz Allen or client site facility.If this position is listed as onsite, you'll work with colleagues and clients in person, as needed for the specific role. EEO Commitment We're an equal employment opportunity/affirmative action employer that empowers our people to fearlessly drive change - no matter their race, color, ethnicity, religion, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, lactation, or related medical conditions), national origin, ancestry, age, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, disability, veteran status, military or uniformed service member status, genetic information, or any other status protected by applicable federal, state, local, or international law.Report this jobDice Id: boozPosition Id: R0162376

title: Junior Application Developer
description: Job Number: R0169663 Application Developer, JuniorThe Opportunity:As a full stack developer, you can resolve a problem with a complete end-to-end solution in a fast, agile environment. If you're looking for the chance to not just develop software, but to help create a system that will make a difference, we need you on our team. We're looking for a developer like you with an appetite to learn and the skills needed to develop software and systems from vision to production-ready.This role is more than just coding. As a full stack developer at Booz Allen, you'll use your passion to learn new tools and techniques and identify needed system improvements. You'll help clients overcome their most difficult challenges using the latest architectural approaches, tools, and technologies. You'll help make sure the solution developed by the team considers the current architecture and operating environment, as well as future functionality and enhancements. Work with us as we shape systems for the better.Join us. The world can't wait.You Have:Experience designing, modifying, developing, writing, and implementing software programming applicationsExperience with basic programming languages, technologies, tools, or web development stacksExperience with Agile methodology, extreme programming, software engineering, product management, or software productsExperience creating solutions to complex problems within a collaborative team environmentAbility to use back-end and front-end languages to develop complete solutionsAbility to obtain a security clearanceHS diploma or GEDIAT Level II certificationNice If You Have:1+ years of experience in software engineeringExperience with Java, Python, C#, C/C++, .NET, JavaScript, React, NodeJS, PHP, or DrupalExperience using back-end and front-end languages to develop complete solutionsAbility to write source code for new applications or generate and enhance code samples for existing applicationsAbility to acquire client requirements and resolve workflow problems through automation optimizationAbility to work with automated testing tools to perform testing and maintenanceSecret clearanceBachelor's degreeClearance: Applicants selected will be subject to a security investigation and may need to meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information.Create Your Career:Grow With UsYour growth matters to us-that's why we offer a variety of ways for you to develop your career. With professional and leadership development opportunities like upskilling programs , tuition reimbursement, mentoring, and firm-sponsored networking, you can chart a unique and fulfilling career path on your own terms.A Place Where You BelongDiverse perspectives cultivate collective ingenuity. Booz Allen's culture of respect, equity, and opportunity means that, here, you are free to bring your whole self to work. With an array of business resource groups and other opportunities for connection, you'll develop your community in no time.Support Your Well-BeingOur comprehensive benefits package includes wellness programs with HSA contributions, paid holidays, paid parental leave, a generous 401(k) match, and more. With these benefits, plus the option for flexible schedules and remote and hybrid locations, we'll support you as you pursue a balanced, fulfilling life-at work and at home.Your Candidate JourneyAt Booz Allen, we know our people are what propel us forward, and we value relationships most of all. Here, we've compiled a list of resources so you'll know what to expect as we forge a connection with you during your journey as a candidate with us.CompensationAt Booz Allen, we celebrate your contributions, provide you with opportunities and choices, and support your total well-being. Our offerings include health, life, disability, financial, and retirement benefits, as well as paid leave, professional development, tuition assistance, work-life programs, and dependent care. Our recognition awards program acknowledges employees for exceptional performance and superior demonstration of our values. Full-time and part-time employees working at least 20 hours a week on a regular basis are eligible to participate in Booz Allen's benefit programs. Individuals that do not meet the threshold are only eligible for select offerings, not inclusive of health benefits. We encourage you to learn more about our total benefits by visiting the Resource page on our Careers site and reviewing Our Employee Benefits page.Salary at Booz Allen is determined by various factors, including but not limited to location, the individual's particular combination of education, knowledge, skills, competencies, and experience, as well as contract-specific affordability and organizational requirements. The projected compensation range for this position is $81,800.00 to $186,000.00 (annualized USD). The estimate displayed represents the typical salary range for this position and is just one component of Booz Allen's total compensation package for employees.Work ModelOur people-first culture prioritizes the benefits of flexibility and collaboration, whether that happens in person or remotely.If this position is listed as remote or hybrid, you'll periodically work from a Booz Allen or client site facility.If this position is listed as onsite, you'll work with colleagues and clients in person, as needed for the specific role. title: Jr. Software Developer
description: We are seeking a junior software developer proficient in programming with C# and VB.Net. The ideal candidate must have experience in creating, developing, and implementing software applications.Key Responsibilities: * Design, code, test and debug software applications utilizing C# and VB.Net. * Collaborate with senior developers on design and coding tasks. * Participate in peer code reviews. * Work with the technical department to ensure that the software meets the company's standards and is functional for end-users. * Continuously update technical knowledge and skills, staying up-to-date with emerging trends and technologies. * Ensure that all software documentation is complete, clear, and up to date.Requirements: * Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or equivalent. * Experience developing software using C# and VB.Net. * A strong understanding of object-oriented programming principles. * Familiarity with MSSQL and database design. * Good communication skills and experience working in a team environment. * A proactive attitude towards learning and problem-solving.Preferred: * Knowledge of ASP.Net web applications. * Experience with T-SQL or PL/SQL. * Familiarity with software assessment tools like TFS, Git, or Jira. Working with an agile environmentReport this jobDice Id: 10115369Position Id: JRSOF03757-55

title: Junior Software Developer
description: Description Talented and professional Software Developers looking for permanent work in the Denver, Colorado area might find the opportunity for them here. You'll be right for this position if you can handle being responsible for implementing new features, maintaining existing code, and refactoring existing code across a breadth of products used both internally and externally at the company. It is preferred for applicants to have a growth mindset and the ability to work both independently and with a team.Key responsibilities- Yield clear and consistent correspondences around solutions and time estimate to client-facing program management teams- Adjust and present production support- Routinely operate code-review and team up with other developers- Cooperate with Scrum team to supply precise work estimates- If you're looking for work where you can maintain and develop new features to internal and external facing software to enhance the customer experience and resolve issues on various operating systems, this job might be for you  Requirements - Less than one year of experience preferred - It is preferred for applicants to have familiarity with scrum - If you're looking for job openings and have knowledge of education standards such as QTI/APIP, SIF, AIF, you might be a good fit for this position - Experience with at least one framework/library, e.g. Vue.js, Polymer, Angular.js, React.js, Ractive.js, Knockout.js, Ember.js, Bootstrap, etc.- Solid understanding of Java - This position will be the best fit for a candidate with experience with software development life cycles, e.g. Agile, Big Bang, Spiral, Waterfall, etc.- Prior work with API design - This position will be the best fit for a candidate who can write clean, standardized code that performs optimally in highly concurrent environments - If you're looking for job openings and have familiarity with full-stack development (front-end, to middle/application tier, to database), you might be a good fit for this position    Technology Doesn't Change the World, People Do.®Robert Half is the world's first and largest specialized talent solutions firm that connects highly qualified job seekers to opportunities at great companies. We provide access to top jobs, competitive compensation and benefits, and free online training. Stay on top of every opportunity - even on the go. Download the Robert Half app and get 1-tap apply, instant notifications for AI-matched jobs, and more.All applicants applying for U.S. job openings must be legally authorized to work in the United States. M/F/Disability/Veterans. By clicking "Apply Now," you're agreeing to Robert Half's Terms of Use.Report this jobDice Id: rhalfintPosition Id: 00610-0012654263

title: Junior Software Engineer at Top...
description: Job Description An Industrial Manufacturing company north of Boston is hiring a Junior Software Engineer to join their team. As a Junior Engineer you will be a part of a team of growing developers and assist in building out mission-critical applications for the company. This role is Hybrid to Beverly, MA, and is a direct hire. This position offers the opportunity to gain experience working on manufacturing applications in a full stack role. You will be developing on an internal application portal that is used by every employee at the company. This application supports the manufacturing of high precision gears that are used widely in medical devices, semiconductors, and even the defense space. The company is seeking a highly motivated to join the team. Required Skills & Experience  Highly skilled in C# and .NET Core development Skilled in working with Angular Exposure to working with SQL Understanding of Manufacturing processes  Desired Skills & Experience  Experience in the Manufacturing Industry 1+ years of developing experience Degree in computer science or a related field Strong technical skills  What You Will Be Doing Daily Responsibilities  100% Hands-On 50% Front-end and 50% Back-end  The Offer   Bonus OR Commission eligible  You will receive the following benefits  Medical Insurance Dental Benefits Vision Benefits Paid Time Off (PTO) 401(k) {including match - if applicable}    Applicants must be currently authorized to work in the US on a full-time basis now and in the future.Report this jobDice Id: 10105282Position Id: 551181

title: Junior Software Engineer -Remote -...
description: Description:The client  is looking for a Software Engineer/Developer to join the authentication services team supporting the Department of Defense (DoD) High Performance Computing Modernization Program (DoD HPCMP).  This is a virtual position that can be accomplished from anywhere in the continental US.The successful candidate will support the development, testing, and deployment of authentication and identity management capabilities enabling access to DoD supercomputers and infrastructure across multiple locations.  Responsibilities will include working with a team of developers and engineers to review and define configurations, develop and update authentication applications and services, and develop and implement testing processes.Flexibility in approach to finding solutions is essential, as well as the ability to understand and act on the customer needs and priorities and learn new technologies quickly. Occasional off-hours activity will be required to perform updates and take part in service restoration efforts. Responsibilities include:Provides support in software development phases that include, but are not limited to:Design (database, GUI, web services, standalone applications)Performance TuningDevelopment and maintenance of authentication applications using multiple languagesUnit and Integration TestingRelease/Patch BuildDeployment/Installation in test and production environmentsUses applicable methodologies, modeling/estimating techniques, tools, applications, systems, software, and databases to perform assigned tasks.Contributes to or develops technical documentation (e.g., Test Cases, Test Plan, updates to application administration documentation) Required Skills and ExperienceRecent experience with C/C++, Python, Perl, and Linux Bash scripting.Experience with writing SQL queries, SQL query optimization, and SQL development tools such as Oracle SQL DeveloperFamiliarity with authentication systems and protocols, including Kerberos, OpenID Connect, and two-factor authenticationFamiliarity with decomposing requirements to provide estimates for completionSelf-starter with ability to multi-task and meet deadlines consistently Desired Skills and ExperienceDevSecOps team experienceVMware Server AdministrationNetworking ExperienceGitLab use as a DevOps platform Other Requirements:Secret Security ClearanceDoD 8570 IAT II (or better) Certification (i.e. Security+) Typical Education and Experience: Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or other related field/concentration and three (3) years or more experience, Additional 4 years of experience in lieu of degreeReport this jobDice Id: 91092880Position Id: 7892674

title: Jr. Application Developer
description: Our client is seeking an Application Developer to join their Team!The Position:The Application Developer will be responsible for the following:Design and develop solutions leveraging our current tech stack (Angular, C#, SQL, ETL, REST API)Build, configure, troubleshoot, and maintain integrations built in Azure Logic Apps or other integration toolsDesign, develop, implement, administer, and provide support for integrationsEngage with business and technical stakeholders to achieve key objectives and solve problemsLead software development initiatives and projectsMaintain technology standards and drive innovation & best practicesProactively identify gaps in the existing infrastructure and development process, acting as a catalyst for change for greater efficiencyBe the best version of yourself every day in a positive, rewarding, and fun environmentReport this jobDice Id: 10121014Position Id: 7887123

title: Junior software Developer
description: Junior Developer Belvedere Tiburon, California   - Needs Power App interface development experience - Team's environment is mostly Microsoft stack - needs good experience with that - SCADA environment experience - Remote server management, set up new environments, maintaining/patching - Doesn't need to be an expert in C#/C++, but some familiarity good. - JavaScript skills for updating some web applications. - Data skills - MS SQL - Can be remote - 3+ years experience - Business System Analyst looking to get into Technology side. title: Junior Software Engineer / .NET...
description: A SaaS company is hiring a Junior .NET Engineer to join their team of 8. This team is highly collaborative and pretty senior, so they are looking for someone with 1-3 years of experience and a degree who wants to learn and grow in their career. This company is well-established and a very well-known software provider in its field, providing end to end solutions to customers more efficiently than competitors. In this role you will work on a variety of software applications, including their brand new client-facing platform. The main tech stack for this role is .NET 6, Rest API, Microservices, AWS Lambdas (serverless experience is a big plus), PostgreSQL, and DB2. The only requirements are .NET Core, API, and some exposure to cloud/Angular/React. This role is 40% front end development and 60% middle tier/backend development. The manager, she is highly passionate and has a clear vision for the team which consists of excellent mentors. This role requires you to live within a commutable distance to La Mirada, CA so you can commute once a week. The other four days are remote, so you must live in Southern California to apply. Required Skills & Experience  1+ years of professional .NET development Experience Bachelor's Degree in STEM Experience using ASP.NET Core Computer Science Fundamentals Experience with JavaScript Rest API SQL  Desired Skills & Experience  Excellent written and verbal communication skills Angular, cloud, or React experience Desire to learn and grow in your career  What You Will Be Doing Daily Responsibilities  40% Front End development 60% Middle Tier/Back End Development  The Offer You will receive the following benefits:  Medical Insurance Dental Benefits Vision Benefits Paid Time Off (PTO) Paid Sick Time 401(k) matching Bonus potential  Applicants must be currently authorized to work in the United States on a full-time basis now and in the future.Report this jobDice Id: 10105282Position Id: 553423

title: JR. SOFTWARE SALES EXECUTIVE
description: SOFTWARE SALES EXECUTIVEALPHARETTA, GAFULL TIME WHO WE ARE: At UBS our goal is to make sure our clients’ customer journey is not only seamless but exceeds their expectations. If you have excellent Customer Service and a Sales track record, come learn about the Software Industry with us!We are looking for several Sales Executives to join our team and participate in different projects. Excellent opportunity for professionals looking to develop in one of the fastest growing industries! RESPONSIBILITIES: Responsible for New Business and Lead Generation Identify prospective clients in your assigned territory through provided resources and independent research.Manage pipeline in CRM tool to provide forecasts on weekly updates to your Sales Manager.Navigate deal cycles 1-3 months in length.Build relationships with key decision-makers and influencers. Qualifications:Experience in Software Sales 1 year plus of proven track sales record AND sales experience selling B2B Software Solutions Bachelor’s Degree or comparable work experience requiredStrong oral and written communication skillsStrong relationship building    Report this jobDice Id: 10116519Position Id: 7878271

title: JR. Software React/Typescript, iOS...
description: Open to  and Green CardPrefers local candidates in Philadelphia - Willing to look at out of state candidates who are willing to travelIf you love audio and building incredible software, then we are the place for you!Use your experience in React, React Native, Typescript, and JavaScript development to make world-class mobile, web, smart speaker, and connected device audio experiences.Help maintain and develop Client Services – a CCS package for our apps that contains our core audio streaming business logic.Partner with all teams and create clear lines of communication.Participate in tech spikes and feasibility studies to help flesh out new ideas and unknowns.Help maintain our code signing and CI/CD pipeline.Work with Jira, our bug tracking and project management software.Contribute using your awesome verbal and written communication skills.Acquire new skills, broaden existing skills, and contribute to others through knowledge sharing and retrospectives – we are better together! Required & Preferred:Degree in Computer Science or related field, or equivalent practical experience.Strong engineering fundamentals including data structures, OOP, time complexity analysis, and code refactoring/reusability.1+ years experience in agile software development.Experience with modern front-end technologies: React, React Native, Typescript, and JavaScript.Experience consuming RESTful APIs.Ability to take design mockups and requirements and create functional components.Experience with Git source control.Experience with native iOS and/or Android development is a plus.Prior experience in unit testing and/or test-driven development is a plus.Experience with various store submission processes is a plus.Experience with app code signing is a plus.Experience with audio streaming standards such as HLS is a plus.Report this jobDice Id: 10106668APosition Id: 7854941
